name: Tree Traversal
description: The process of visiting each node in a tree data structureâ€”common types include inorder, preorder, and postorder traversals.

name: AVL Trees
description: A type of self-balancing binary search tree where the difference of heights between left and right subtrees for every node is at most one.

name: Red-Black Trees
description: A self-balancing binary search tree using an extra bit of storage (color) per node to ensure the tree remains balanced during insertions and deletions.

name: B-Trees
description: A self-balancing search tree in which nodes can have multiple children and is optimized for systems that read and write large blocks of data.
